title: Zucchini Growing Hacks for ENDLESS Harvests!

tasks.task: Growing zucchini plants and increasing yield.
subtasks: Creating raised soil mound for plant.
Hand pollinating flowers to ensure fruiting.
Watering base of plant rather than leaves to prevent mildew.
Adding mulch around plant to retain soil moisture.
Regularly harvesting zucchini when they reach 6-8 inches.
Sharing excess zucchini with neighbors.

tasks.task: Sharing knowledge and recipes related to high-yield gardening.
subtasks: Encouraging viewers to comment on favorite zucchini recipes.
Promoting social media engagement by asking followers to favorite content.

tasks.task: Ensuring proper care for zucchini plants to prevent disease.
subtasks: Avoiding wet leaves to reduce risk of mildew.
Using mulch to help retain soil moisture.

tasks.task: Regarding the other elements, like sharing recipes and engaging on social media, those are more related to promoting your channel or community engagement, which might not be considered physical tasks. So maybe those are separate MAINTASKs.
Growing zucchini plants and increasing yield.
MAINTASK: Growing zucchini plants and increasing yield.
subtasks: Creating a 12-inch high soil mound (hill) for the plant.
Hand pollinating flowers by transferring pollen from male (long stems) to female (base with baby zucchini) flowers.
Watering the base of the plant while keeping leaves dry to prevent mildew.
Applying mulch around the base of the plant to retain soil moisture.
Harvesting zucchini fruits every 2-3 days when they reach 6-8 inches in size.
Sharing excess zucchini with neighbors.

tasks.task: Sharing knowledge and engaging with the community.
subtasks: Encouraging viewers to comment on favorite zucchini recipes.
Promoting social media interaction by asking followers to comment.
